Job Title: Manager of Project Sustainment - NRE (Palatine, IL)

Location: Palatine, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
Nelnet Renewable Energy began from Nelnet, a company that started 40-plus years ago with a purpose to serve our customers and communities. Over the years, our corporate color green has taken on new meaning as we’ve applied multiple capabilities to our passion for supporting a transition to renewable energy. Learn more about who we are, what we do – and the many ways we can help you achieve your sustainability and financial goals.

Nelnet is a diversified and innovative company committed to enriching lives through the power of service as a student loan servicer, professional services company, consumer loan originator and servicer, payments processor, renewable energy solutions, and K-12 and higher education expert.

Nelnet Renewable Energy offers a vast portfolio of solutions to help support residents, commercial and industrial customers, landowners, developers, investors, CleanTech and ClimateTech innovators, and educational institutions in meeting their renewable energy goals. As a large, diversified company driven by a purpose to serve, we deliver broad expertise, innovative solutions, financial capital, and established networks to help our customers and partners power a more sustainable future.

Nelnet Renewable Energy is proud to be a Nelnet company. Founded over 45 years ago, Nelnet is a publicly traded (NYSE: NNI), investment-grade company offering a diverse set of solutions across a wide range of markets and industries. Our involvement in renewable energy began in 2018 with a commitment to fund over $142 million for the building of solar energy projects via tax equity financing. Since then, our commitment grew, leading us to develop a new brand, Nelnet Renewable Energy, offering a range of renewable energy solutions. In 2022, we acquired leading engineering, procurement, and construction firm GRNE Solar, enabling us to offer expert residential, commercial, and small utility-scale installation services.

The Manager of Project Sustainment is a pivotal operations-focused role dedicated to the ongoing success and smooth operation of completed projects. This position requires a unique blend of technical knowledge, customer service skills, and leadership, ensuring that all projects continue to meet or exceed expectations.

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

 Serve as the primary contact for commercial solar clients during the post-construction phase, addressing concerns to ensure client satisfaction. Train, mentor, and develop team members in both the commercial and residential sides of the solar business. Working collaboratively with other teams, lead the creation, negotiation, and execution of commercial operations and maintenance contracts. Lead and oversee the residential solar service team, serve as a subject matter expert on warranty and workmanship claims. Develop processes and procedures to monitor system performance across the portfolio, proactively addressing any substandard performance. Utilize NRE’s pool of electricians and apprentices as necessary to be sure all operations and maintenance work is performed per contractual obligations. Facilitate communication and coordination among owners and stakeholders to align project sustainment objectives. Review and negotiate contracts to ensure terms and conditions support project goals. Ensure that work is done in a collaborative, safety-first manner, striving at all times for Operational Excellence.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

 Proven experience as an O&M or Service Manager in the solar industry. Residential and Commercial experience required. Strong knowledge of safety regulations and laws (OSHA, EPA, etc.). Bachelor's degree in engineering, construction management, or a related field preferred, or a combination of education and experience. Excellent communication and leadership skills. Ability to teach and mentor electricians and technicians in testing and commissioning procedures on residential and commercial solar installations. Thorough knowledge of industry standards for testing and commissioning of commercial solar installations; structural, mechanical, and electrical.This position will be based out of our Palatine office with some Hybrid work availability.Pay range for this role is $120,000 -$150,000 annually, depending on experience.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: 

 Proven experience as an O&M or Service Manager in the solar industry. Residential and Commercial experience required. Strong knowledge of safety regulations and laws (OSHA, EPA, etc.). Bachelor's degree in engineering, construction management, or a related field preferred, or a combination of education and experience. Excellent communication and leadership skills. Ability to teach and mentor electricians and technicians in testing and commissioning procedures on residential and commercial solar installations. Thorough knowledge of industry standards for testing and commissioning of commercial solar installations; structural, mechanical, and electrical.

COMPETENCIES – SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE/ABILITIES:

 Strong leadership and team management skills. Excellent communication and customer service skills. Thorough understanding of renewable energy systems and their maintenance requirements. Ability to analyze data and make informed decisions to enhance project sustainability. Proficiency in project and operations management software.

Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, HSA and FSA, generous earned time off, 401K/student loan repayment, life insurance & AD&D insurance, employee assistance program, employee stock purchase program, tuition reimbursement, performance-based incentive pay, short- and long-term disability, and a robust wellness program. Click here to learn more about our benefits: LINK.

Nelnet is an Equal Opportunity Employer, complies with Executive Order 11246, and takes affirmative action to ensure that qualified applicants are employed, and that employees are treated during employment, without regard to race, color, religion/creed, national origin, gender, or sex, marital status, age, disability, use of a guide dog or service animal, sexual orientation, military/veteran status, or any other status protected by Federal or State law or local ordinance.

Qualified individuals with disabilities who require reasonable accommodations in order to apply or compete for positions at Nelnet may request such accommodations by contacting Corporate Recruiting at 402-486-5725 or corporaterecruiting@nelnet.net.

Nelnet is a Drug Free and Tobacco Free Workplace.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
